# [\#12889 Issue](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/12889) `closed`: The bytecode of the compiled output of truffle and solc is different.

#### <img src="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/10923091?u=8297295cdc0493d4bd9b5ba4711c3b07c5c7b836&v=4" width="50">[tanhuiya](https://github.com/tanhuiya) opened issue at [2022-04-02 01:51](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/12889):

I use same version of solc compiler (v0.8.13)

When I compile a single contract, their bytecode output is the same.

But, When I compile a contract with inheritance, their bytecode output is not the same. The bytecode output by solc is much larger.

```
contract:
//SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol";

contract Greeter is ERC20 {
    string private greeting;

    constructor() ERC20("AAA", "bbb") {

    }

    function initiate(string memory _greeting) public {
        greeting = _greeting;
    }

    function greet() public view returns (string memory) {
        return greeting;
    }

    function setGreeting(string memory _greeting) public {
        greeting = _greeting;
    }
}

```


> output of truffle (truffle compile)
```
Truffle:


Solc:  

```
